Beyonc.passage: Beyoncé Giselle Knowles-Carter (/biːˈjɒnseɪ/; born September 4, 1981) is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and record producer. Born and raised in Houston, Texas, Beyoncé performed in various singing and dancing competitions as a child. She rose to fame in the late 1990s as lead singer of the R&B girl-group Destiny's Child, one of the best-selling girl groups in history. Beyoncé's debut solo album, Dangerously in Love (2003), spawned the number-one singles "Crazy in Love" and "Baby Boy" and earned her five Grammy Awards. Her second solo album, B'Day (2006), contained the top-ten singles "Deja Vu", "Irreplaceable", and "Beautiful Liar". Beyoncé's third solo album, I Am... Sasha Fierce (2008), saw the release of the successful singles "If I Were a Boy", "Single Ladies (Put a Ring on It)", and "Halo", and earned her six Grammy Awards. Following the release of her fourth solo album, 4 (2011), Beyoncé became the first female artist to have four consecutive number-one albums on the US Billboard 200 chart. Beyoncé's fifth solo album, Beyoncé (2013), was a critical and commercial success. It was distinguished by its experimental production and exploration of darker themes, and its release was accompanied by a surprise self-titled visual album.

Ariana Grande.passage: Ariana Grande-Butera (born June 26, 1993) is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She began her career in 2008 in the Broadway musical 13, before playing the role of Cat Valentine in the Nickelodeon television series Victorious (2010–2013) and in the spinoff Sam & Cat (2013–2014). She has received numerous accolades, including three American Music Awards, three MTV Europe Music Awards, and four Grammy Award nominations. Grande's music career began with the soundtrack Music from Victorious (2011). She released her first studio album, Yours Truly, in 2013, which debuted atop the US Billboard 200. The album's lead single, "The Way", debuted in the top 10 of the Billboard Hot 100, and was followed by the release of the successful singles "Baby I" and "Right There". Her second studio album, My Everything (2014), continued the commercial success of its predecessor, and spawned the hit singles "Problem", "Break Free", and "Bang Bang". In 2016, she released her third studio album, Dangerous Woman, which produced the hit singles "Dangerous Woman", "Into You", and "Side to Side". Grande has also ventured into acting, starring in the 2015 film adaptation of the musical comedy-drama, Grease Live, and in the 2018 film, The Lego Movie 2: The Second Part. She has also contributed to various charitable organizations and has a large following on social media.

Taylor Swift.passage: Taylor Alison Swift (born December 13, 1989) is an American singer-songwriter, musician, and actress. She was born in Reading, Pennsylvania, and later moved to Nashville, Tennessee, at the age of 14 to pursue a career in country music. Swift's first album, Taylor Swift (2006), was a commercial success and produced four hit singles. Her second album, Fearless (2008), became the best-selling album of 2009 and won four Grammy Awards. Swift's third album, Speak Now (2010), was also a commercial success and spawned several hit singles, including "Mine" and "Back to December". Swift's fourth album, Red (2012), marked a departure from her country roots and included more pop and rock elements. The album spawned several hit singles, including "We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together" and "I Knew You Were Trouble". Swift's fifth album, 1989 (2014), was a critical and commercial success and marked a complete departure from her country roots. The album spawned several hit singles, including "Shake It Off" and "Blank Space". Swift's sixth album, Reputation (2017), was also a commercial success and spawned several hit singles, including "Look What You Made Me Do" and "Delicate". Swift's seventh album, Lover (2019), was a critical and commercial success and included the hit singles "You Need to Calm Down" and "Lover". Swift has won numerous awards, including ten Grammy Awards, five American Music Awards, and five Guinness World Records.

Ed Sheeran.passage: Edward Christopher Sheeran, born 17 February 1991, is an English singer, songwriter, guitarist, and record producer. In early 2011, Sheeran independently released the extended play, No. 5 Collaborations Project, which caught the attention of both Elton John and Jamie Foxx, who invited him to perform on their respective shows. He then signed with Asylum Records. Sheeran's debut studio album, + (pronounced "plus"), was released in September 2011 and has since been certified seven-times platinum in the UK. The album contains his hit single "The A Team", which earned him the Ivor Novello Award for Best Song Musically and Lyrically. In 2012, Sheeran won the Brit Awards for Best British Male Solo Artist and British Breakthrough Act. Sheeran's second studio album, x (pronounced "multiply"), was released in June 2014 and has since been certified four-times platinum in the UK. The album includes his hit singles "Sing" and "Thinking Out Loud", which won him two Grammy Awards for Song of the Year and Best Pop Solo Performance. In 2015, Sheeran released his third studio album, ÷ (pronounced "divide"), which debuted at number one in the UK and the US. The album includes his hit singles "Shape of You" and "Castle on the Hill", which broke records in the UK by debuting at numbers one and two respectively. Sheeran also became the first artist to have two songs debut in the US top 10 in the same week.

Adele.passage: Adele Laurie Blue Adkins, born on May 5, 1988, is a British singer-songwriter. She is known for her soulful voice and her ability to write heartfelt lyrics that resonate with her listeners. Adele was raised in Tottenham, North London, and began singing at a young age. She was influenced by artists such as Etta James, Ella Fitzgerald, and Aretha Franklin. Adele's debut album, "19," was released in 2008 and received critical acclaim. The album featured hits such as "Chasing Pavements" and "Hometown Glory." Her second album, "21," was released in 2011 and became an international success. The album included the hit single "Rolling in the Deep" and won multiple Grammy Awards. Adele's third album, "25," was released in 2015 and broke multiple records upon its release. The album sold over 3 million copies in its first week and became the best-selling album of the 21st century in the United States. The album featured hits such as "Hello" and "When We Were Young." Adele has won numerous awards throughout her career, including 15 Grammy Awards, an Academy Award, and a Golden Globe Award. She has also been named one of Time Magazine's 100 most influential people in the world. Adele is known for her powerful and emotional performances, and her ability to connect with her audience. She has been praised for her authenticity and her willingness to be vulnerable in her music. Despite her success, Adele has remained grounded and has spoken openly about her struggles with anxiety and depression.

Bruno Mars.passage: Bruno Mars (born Peter Gene Hernandez; October 8, 1985) is an American singer, songwriter, record producer, and dancer. Born and raised in Honolulu, Hawaii, Mars moved to Los Angeles in 2003 to pursue a musical career. After being dropped by Motown Records, Mars signed a recording contract with Atlantic Records in 2009. Mars' debut studio album, Doo-Wops & Hooligans (2010), included the international hit singles "Just the Way You Are" and "Grenade". The album was a commercial success, peaking at number three on the US Billboard 200 and being certified diamond by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). Mars' second studio album, Unorthodox Jukebox (2012), peaked at number one on the US Billboard 200 and featured the singles "Locked Out of Heaven" and "When I Was Your Man". Mars' third studio album, 24K Magic (2016), earned him his first number one on the US Billboard 200 and featured the title track "24K Magic" and the singles "That's What I Like" and "Versace on the Floor". Mars' music is known for its combination of rock, R&B, soul, funk, and hip hop influences, as well as his retro-inspired style and stage performances. Mars has won 11 Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year for 24K Magic, and has sold over 200 million records worldwide. He has also been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world.

Rihanna.passage: Rihanna is a Barbadian singer, songwriter, actress, and entrepreneur. Born in Saint Michael and raised in Bridgetown, she first entered the music industry by recording demo tapes under the guidance of record producer Evan Rogers in 2003. She subsequently signed a recording contract with Def Jam Recordings after auditioning for its then-president, hip-hop producer and rapper Jay-Z. Rihanna's debut studio album, Music of the Sun (2005), peaked within the top ten in Canada and the United States, and features the hit single "Pon de Replay". Her second studio album, A Girl Like Me (2006), peaked within the top-five in the United States, and produced the successful singles "SOS" and "Unfaithful". Rihanna's third studio album, Good Girl Gone Bad (2007), marked a departure from her previous music style and incorporated more elements of dance-pop and R&B. It was a commercial success, peaking at number two on the US Billboard 200, and produced the international hit singles "Umbrella", "Don't Stop the Music", and "Take a Bow". Rihanna's fourth studio album, Rated R (2009), was a departure from her previous music style and incorporated more elements of rock and R&B. It peaked at number four on the US Billboard 200 and produced the hit singles "Russian Roulette" and "Rude Boy". Her fifth studio album, Loud (2010), peaked at number three on the US Billboard 200 and produced the hit singles "Only Girl (In the World)", "What's My Name? ", and "S&M".

Justin Bieber.passage: Justin Bieber is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and actor. Bieber was discovered in 2008 by Scooter Braun, who happened to come across Bieber's videos on YouTube and later became his manager. Braun arranged for him to meet with Usher and his then-label, Island Records. Bieber's debut single, "One Time", was released in 2009 and peaked at number 12 on the US Billboard Hot 100. His debut album, My World, followed later that same year. It was a commercial success, debuting at number one in several countries, including Canada and the United States. Bieber released his second album, My World 2.0, in 2010. It debuted at number one in several countries, and was preceded by the single "Baby", which became his most successful song to date, reaching number one in several countries and setting a record for the most views in a 24-hour period on Vevo. Bieber has won numerous awards throughout his career, including a Grammy Award for Best Dance Recording for the song "Where Are Ü Now" at the 2016 ceremony. He has been listed as one of Time magazine's most influential people in the world, and has been considered a teen idol and a cultural icon. Bieber has been involved in several controversies, including being arrested for vandalism in 2014 and being accused of assault in 2020. He has also been criticized for his behavior, including his use of racist language and his controversial comments on social media. Despite this, Bieber remains a popular and influential figure in the entertainment industry.

Lady Gaga.passage: Lady Gaga, born Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta, is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and activist. She was born on March 28, 1986, in New York City, New York, to Cynthia Louise (Bissett) and Joseph Anthony Germanotta, Jr. Gaga rose to fame with her debut album, The Fame, released in 2008, which was a critical and commercial success and included the hit songs "Just Dance" and "Poker Face". She followed this with the similarly successful albums The Fame Monster (2009) and Born This Way (2011), which explored themes of sexuality, individuality, and empowerment. Gaga has won numerous awards, including six Grammy Awards, three Brit Awards, and two Guinness World Records. She has sold an estimated 30 million albums and 150 million singles worldwide, making her one of the best-selling music artists in history. In addition to her music career, Gaga is known for her philanthropic work and activism, particularly in the LGBTQ+ community. She has been a vocal advocate for LGBTQ+ rights and has used her platform to raise awareness and funds for various causes, including HIV/AIDS and mental health. Gaga has also acted in several films, including the 2018 remake of A Star Is Born, for which she received critical acclaim and won several awards, including a Golden Globe and an Academy Award for Best Original Song. She has also made headlines for her fashion and avant-garde style, often wearing elaborate and provocative outfits on stage and in public.

Shawn Mendes.passage: Shawn Mendes (born Shawn Peter Raul Mendes; August 8, 1998) is a Canadian singer, songwriter, and model. He gained a following in 2013, when he began posting cover versions of popular songs to Vine. The following year, he caught the attention of Island Records and his debut single, "Life of the Party", was released in June 2014. His self-titled debut album was released in 2015, and included the single "Stitches", which reached the top 10 in the US and Canada. Mendes' second album, Illuminate, was released in 2016, and included the single "Treat You Better". He has since released three more albums, including his most recent, "Shawn Mendes: The Album", which was released in 2018. Mendes has won several awards throughout his career, including eight MTV Europe Music Awards, three Juno Awards, and two American Music Awards. In addition to his music career, Mendes has also modeled for brands such as Calvin Klein and H&M. He has been involved in several philanthropic endeavors, including his own charity, Shawn Mendes Foundation, which supports various causes such as education, healthcare, and the environment. Mendes has also been involved in campaigns for organizations such as Do Something and the Malala Fund. Mendes has been open about his struggles with anxiety and depression, and has used his platform to raise awareness about mental health. He has also been vocal about his support for the LGBTQ+ community, and has been recognized for his efforts in promoting equality and acceptance.

Tottenham.passage: Tottenham is a district in north London, England, in the London Borough of Haringey. It is located 8.2 miles (13.2 km) north of Charing Cross. The area is identified in the London Plan as one of 35 major centres in Greater London. Tottenham has a long history as a settlement, with evidence of a Saxon settlement existing in the area. The name Tottenham is believed to have originated from the Old English personal name Tota and ham, meaning "homestead or settlement of Tota's family". In the Middle Ages, Tottenham was a rural village, with market gardens supplying food to London. The opening of the Lea Bridge in 1742 allowed easier transportation of goods to and from the area, leading to the growth of industry in Tottenham. The construction of the railway in the mid-19th century allowed for further expansion and development of the area. Tottenham has a number of notable landmarks and attractions, including White Hart Lane, the home of Tottenham Hotspur Football Club, and Bruce Castle, a 16th-century mansion that is now a museum. In recent years, Tottenham has undergone significant regeneration, with a number of new developments and infrastructure projects being completed.
